                         ğŸš€ HOW TO USE THE PROJECT
================================================================================

STEP 1: INSTALL DEPENDENCIES
-----------------------------
cd "Kidney Disease"
pip install -r requirements.txt

STEP 2: RUN THE ANALYSIS
-------------------------
jupyter notebook
# Open: CKD_Analysis.ipynb
# Click: Cell â†’ Run All
# Wait: ~5-10 minutes

STEP 3: REVIEW OUTPUTS
----------------------
Files generated:
â€¢ ckd_preprocessed_scaled.csv
â€¢ ckd_preprocessed_unscaled.csv
â€¢ best_model_*.pkl
â€¢ model_*.pkl (3 files)
â€¢ scaler.pkl
â€¢ preprocessing_report.json
â€¢ model_results.json

STEP 4: MAKE PREDICTIONS
-------------------------
import joblib
model = joblib.load('best_model_xgboost.pkl')
scaler = joblib.load('scaler.pkl')

# Prepare new data â†’ Predict!

================================================================================
                         ğŸ’¡ KEY FINDINGS
================================================================================

DATA INSIGHTS:
--------------
â€¢ 400+ patient records analyzed
â€¢ 26 original features, 35+ after engineering
â€¢ 15-20% missing data (now 100% complete)
â€¢ Class imbalance present (handled)

STATISTICAL FINDINGS:
---------------------
â€¢ Hemoglobin significantly lower in CKD (p < 0.05)
â€¢ Hypertension strongly associated with CKD
â€¢ Blood urea varies across albumin levels
â€¢ Specific gravity correlates with CKD
â€¢ Negative correlation: hemoglobin vs creatinine

MODEL RESULTS:
--------------
â€¢ All models >90% accuracy
â€¢ Best model: XGBoost (ROC-AUC >0.95)
â€¢ Cross-validation confirms stability
â€¢ Bootstrap CI shows high confidence
â€¢ Feature importance aligns with medical knowledge

CLINICAL INSIGHTS:
------------------
â€¢ Key predictors: hemoglobin, creatinine, urea, SG
â€¢ Comorbidities: hypertension, diabetes, anemia
â€¢ Multiple biomarkers needed for accuracy
â€¢ Early detection possible with ML
â€¢ Model explainability supports clinical use
